title: What are the ideas of Albert Camus? - Quora

response.answer_text: Literature aside (there is already a good post about Camus and absurdism), one thing I admire about Camus was that he wanted people to come together and unite in better ways than they had in the past. Here’s an example from his Wikipedia page: In 1944, Camus founded the "French Committee for the European Federation" (Comité Français pour la Féderation Européenne – CFFE) declaring that Europe "can only evolve along the path of economic progress, democracy and peace if the nation states become a federation."
I think if he had a theme, it would be called “tragic absurdity.”
